acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in transfers of court papers from Warren County. The Free Negro Lists and Registration Certificates, 1837-1861, and request for free papers, 1857, came to the Library in a transfer under accession numbers 37580, 37581, and 37582.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Warren County was named for Joseph Warren, the revolutionary patriot who sent Paul Revere and William Dawes on their famous rides and who was killed at the Battle of Bunker Hill. The county was formed from Shenandoah and Frederick Counties in 1836.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Warren County (Va.) Free Negro Records, 1836-1861. The collection contains two Free Negro Delinquent Tax Lists, 1837 and 1840; Free Negro Registration Certificates, 1836-1861; Free Negro Lists, 1855, 1859, and 1861; an order to transfer the indenture of James Franklin Supton, a free boy of color, from Charles D. Shambaugh to Mrs. Mary Lanick of Frederick County, 1855; and a List of the Ages of Negroes Emancipated by Lucy Hansbrough, 1856; and a request from Nancy Walker for free papers, 1857 Dec. 24.

Free Negro Lists were compiled by the Commissioner of Revenue for tax purposes. They usually contain name, age, gender, and occupation of free Negroes assessed for taxes. Delinquent tax lists contain names of free Negroes who have not paid taxes for a given year. This list also identifies individuals exempt from the tax and individuals who did not own any property.

The Free Negro Registration Certificates, 1836-1861, contain name, sometimes age, and a brief physical description, and the circumstances of the person's freedom or emancipation. If born free, reference is sometimes made to parents. If emancipated, the emancipating owner, place and date of emancipation, and prior registration as a free Negro are usually mentioned. The certificate of Hannah Henry indicates she was the daughter of Delilah Henry, one of the slaves emancipated by the estate of Robert Carter.
